intro: Spermacoce islana, commonly known as the island spiderling, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and a distinctive tubular corolla. Spermacoce islana is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
